revised_title: Classification of Celestial Objects and Catalogue of 500 New Nebulae
tldr: This article presents a classification of celestial objects and a catalogue of 500 new nebulae discovered by William Herschel. The author divides these objects into twelve classes, including insulated stars, binary sidereal systems, multiple stars, clustering stars, groups of stars, and clusters of stars. The article also discusses the nature of nebulosity and nebulous stars, and provides a detailed catalogue of the newly discovered nebulae.
